Donald Rumsfeld also defends the use of harsh interrogation tactics in his interview, saying that they "saved lives." But he also admits that interrogators went past his orders with at least one detainee, Mohammed al-Qahtani : Qahtani would be subjected to sexual humiliation and long periods of sleep deprivation and isolation while in custody at Guantanamo, and his heartbeat at one point dropped to 35 beats per minute.
